yeah i know i know

to go to harvard it was close to home that was always something that was important to me but then covet happened and they canceled their season pretty much and i kind of had to make a decision whether i wanted to go to ushl or looking at their schools fortunately he looked at michigan i just kind of really liked it the first time i kind of looked around and kind of felt like the right place and you know when you get that feeling and that's kind of the feeling i got so i think like two weeks before school started i ended up applying here and getting in so that's kind of how i got here it was all it was all pretty crazy summer to say the least a crazy summer followed by an even crazier season but veneers excel leading the wolverines in shot percentage and goals during the regular season lighting the lamp 10 times i didn't really put too much pressure on myself to do really well i didn't really think about like obviously it's my draft season i don't really think about that too much it's just kind of like going out there and having fun that's kind of something that's my dad's always taught me when i was growing up and then now here i can try to like keep keep that going maddie talks about love of the game over expectations and that approach has helped elevate his team as well he's been a tremendous all-around player you trust him as a coach to play in any situation you know he's going to play on the right side of the puck and then he's got the skill offensively to play on the offensive side so very fortunate to have him here and he's a lot of fun to coach in practice he makes everyone a better player just you're going up against him and you kind of like okay i'm going up against maddie i have to i have to be ready but i feel bad for other guys in the big ten who have to play against him and i think he's got everything he's got the heart he's got the attitude he's got the work ethic ironically despite his marksmanship this year benier says he's always been a past first kind of player i kind of just like really focused in the last like couple months here working with coaches on like shooting getting a better shot like my release and even just being like like knowing when to shoot and when to pass let me get this straight the team's leading goal scorer needs work on his goal scoring mentality yeah i know i know i think hopefully if i keep doing that you know results will show but it's it's always nice when you are working really hard at something and then you get a little success in that area so hopefully i can keep that going along with everyone
